i can dual boot: Which hardware raid controller is it?

You'd know when you'd have hardware raid controller. Most likely it is a software raid controller, and in that case, you simply cant setup a dualboot which actually works, since the "raid" is only visible from within windows.
But you cant use that "raid" from within Ubuntu.
Forget about windows driven software raid, and re-setup your box.
Reinstall, without any form of software raid.
Thats a RAID0, not a RAID1, as you assumed earlier.
And a windows driven raid0 is totally unusable in linux.
I gave you a pretty precise answer :)
if this is any relevant, look at this: https://dl.dropbox.com/u/59319743/Capturar.PNG
Then provide the output of sudo fdisk -l from linux
